reasoning: Breast papilloma is a benign lesion typically reported as prevalence rather than incidence. Prevalence estimates range 1-5% in women with benign breast disease and abnormal imaging; using 2.5% (2,500 per 100k) as midpoint estimate from pathology and imaging studies. Limited epidemiological surveillance data; primary data from pathology series and mammography studies.
source: Estimate based on pathology and imaging surveillance studies; no single authoritative epidemiological registry
